intro: Galium praemontanum var. armazicum, commonly known as the Armenian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a low-growing perennial that features slender, hairy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species within the Rubiaceae family.
